1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2
3-- | Sort by ascending order or descending order.
4
5module Koshucode.Baala.Base.List.Order
6  ( -- * Data type
7    OrderCap (..),
8    orderingCap,
9    sortByName,
10    sortWith,
11
12    -- * Rank
13    Ranking,
14    sortByNameNumbering,
15    sortByNameDenseRank,
16    sortByNameGapRank,
17    denseRankFrom,
18    gapRankFrom,
19  ) where
20
21import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture          as O
22import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.Prelude      as B
23import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.List.Select  as B
24
25-- | Data for indicating order.
26data OrderCap a
27    = Asc a     -- ^ Ascending order
28    | Desc a    -- ^ Descending order
29      deriving (Show, Eq)
30
31instance (Ord a) => Ord (OrderCap a) where
32    compare (Asc  x) (Asc  y) = compare x y
33    compare (Desc x) (Desc y) = compare y x
34    compare (Asc  _) (Desc _) = LT
35    compare (Desc _) (Asc  _) = GT
36
37type OrderCapping a = a -> OrderCap a
38
39-- | Select order cap for ordering value.
40--   'GT' and 'EQ' mean 'Asc', 'LT' means 'Desc'.
41orderingCap :: (Ordering, a) -> OrderCap a
42orderingCap (LT, a) = Desc a
43orderingCap (_ , a) = Asc  a
44
45cap :: OrderCap a -> OrderCapping b
46cap (Asc  _) = Asc
47cap (Desc _) = Desc
48
49-- | Extract content from order cap.
50uncap :: OrderCap a -> a
51uncap (Asc  a) = a
52uncap (Desc a) = a
53
54-- | Sort by capped name.
55--
56--   >>> sortByName (words "a b c") [Asc "b"] [[1,3,3], [1,2,3], [1,1,3 :: Int]]
57--   [[1,1,3], [1,2,3], [1,3,3]]
58--
59sortByName :: (Ord a, Eq n) => [OrderCap n] -> [n] -> O.Map [[a]]
60sortByName ords ns = map snd . sortByNameOrder ords ns
61
62sortByNameOrder :: (Ord a, Eq n) => [OrderCap n] -> [n] -> [[a]] -> [([OrderCap a], [a])]
63sortByNameOrder ords ns xs = sortBy ords2 xs2 where
64    ords2  = map cap   ords
65    ns2    = map uncap ords
66    p      = ns2 `B.selectIndex` ns
67    xs2    = map f xs
68    f x    = (B.selectElems p x, x)
69
70sortBy :: (Ord a, Ord b) => [OrderCapping a] -> [([a], b)] -> [([OrderCap a], b)]
71sortBy ords = B.sort . B.mapFstTo (caps ords)
72
73caps :: [OrderCapping a] -> [a] -> [OrderCap a]
74caps ords = zipWith ($) (ords ++ repeat Asc)
75
76-- | Sort elements by function result.
77--
78--   >>> sortWith length $ words "aaa b ccc dd"
79--   ["b", "dd", "aaa", "ccc"]
80--
81sortWith :: (Ord a, Ord b) => (a -> b) -> O.Map [a]
82sortWith f = map snd . B.sort . map g where
83    g x = (f x, x)
84
85
86-- ----------------------  Rank
87
88-- | Ranking function.
89type Ranking n a
90    = Int               -- ^ Number of the top rank.
91    -> [OrderCap n]     -- ^ Ranking specification.
92    -> [n]              -- ^ Term names.
93    -> [[a]]            -- ^ List of tuples.
94    -> ([Int], [[a]])   -- ^ Ranks and sorted data.
95
96-- | Sort and numbering like 1234.
97sortByNameNumbering :: (Ord a, Eq n) => Ranking n a
98sortByNameNumbering i ords ns = number . sortByName ords ns where
99    number xs = (take (length xs) [i..], xs)
100
101-- | Sort and rank like 1223.
102--
103--   >>> sortByNameDenseRank 1 [Asc "a"] ["a", "b"] [["b", "y"], ["a", "x"], ["a", "y"]]
104--   ([1,1,2], [["a","x"], ["a","y"], ["b","y"]])
105--
106--   >>> sortByNameDenseRank 0 [Asc "b"] ["a", "b"] [["b", "y"], ["a", "x"], ["a", "y"]]
107--   ([0,1,1], [["a","x"], ["a","y"], ["b","y"]])
108--
109--   >>> sortByNameDenseRank 0 [Desc "a"] ["a", "b"] [["b", "y"], ["a", "x"], ["a", "y"]]
110--   ([0,1,1], [["b","y"], ["a","x"], ["a","y"]])
111--
112sortByNameDenseRank :: (Ord a, Eq n) => Ranking n a
113sortByNameDenseRank i = sortByNameWithRank $ denseRankFrom i
114
115-- | Sort and rank like 1224.
116sortByNameGapRank :: (Ord a, Eq n) => Ranking n a
117sortByNameGapRank i = sortByNameWithRank $ gapRankFrom i
118
119sortByNameWithRank :: (Ord a, Eq n) => ([[OrderCap a]] -> [r]) -> [OrderCap n] -> [n] -> [[a]] -> ([r], [[a]])
120sortByNameWithRank ranking ords ns xs = (rank, xs3) where
121    xs2  = sortByNameOrder ords ns xs
122    ord2 = map fst xs2
123    xs3  = map snd xs2
124    rank = ranking ord2
125
126-- | 1223 ranking start with given number.
127--
128--   >>> denseRankFrom (1 :: Int) "abbc"
129--   [1,2,2,3]
130--
131denseRankFrom :: (Ord a, Integral r) => r -> [a] -> [r]
132denseRankFrom start xs = rank xs start where
133    rank []  _ = []
134    rank [_] r = [r]
135    rank (x : ys@(y : _)) r
136        | x == y    = r : rank ys r
137        | otherwise = r : rank ys (r + 1)
138
139-- | 1224 ranking start with given number.
140--
141--   >>> gapRankFrom (1 :: Int) "abbc"
142--   [1,2,2,4]
143--
144gapRankFrom :: (Ord a, Integral r) => r -> [a] -> [r]
145gapRankFrom start xs = rank xs start start where
146    rank []  _ _ = []
147    rank [_] _ r = [r]
148    rank (x : ys@(y : _)) n r
149        | x == y    = r : rank ys (n + 1) r
150        | otherwise = r : rank ys (n + 1) (n + 1)
151
